SENT.plain: Spontaneous carotid artery dissection is one of the main causes of stroke in young adults
We report two cases occurring after non-traumatic hyperextension of the head
Most of these events result from minor head trauma
Some family history cases would suggest the possibility of an underlying artery wall disorder
The favorable natural history of carotid dissection emphasizes the need for a noninvasive approach for diagnosis
Delayed diagnosis may lead to poor prognosis
Ultrasonography and magnetic resonance angiography are adequate for diagnosis
